source_sentence: 諸大弟子及佛自說業報
translation: the karmic retribution of great disciples and the Buddha's own explanation

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽因緣曰：「具壽蜜性已說業報訖，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks and nuns told Kauśāmbī, "Kauśāmbī has explained the nature of karmic retribution and will next explain it to Kauśāmbī."

source_sentence: 于時因緣即說頌曰：「九十一劫時，　　我在親慧城；　見毘鉢尸佛，　　欲入大都郭。
translation: The causes and conditions then spoke a verse, saying, "During the 91st eon, I was in the city of intimate wisdom when I saw Vipaśyin Buddha and wanted to enter the great capital city.

source_sentence: 我既見大悲，　　妙花散於上；　花開莖卓竪，　　佛頂上為蓋。
translation: Now that I've seen great compassion, a marvelous flower spreads out from above; its blossoming stalk rises up, and the Buddha's head becomes a lid.

source_sentence: 淨心投佛足，　　虔恭頭面禮；　十指端合掌，　　敬重右圍遶。
translation: With a pure heart, I threw my arms around the Buddha's feet, reverently bowed with my head and face, put my palms together at the end of my ten fingers, and respectfully circled to my right.

source_sentence: 不聞彼佛法，　　亦不受三歸；　但發清淨心，　　隨善逝而去。
translation: I don't hear the Buddha's teaching, nor do I accept the three refuges; instead, I arouse a pure mind and follow the well-vanished away.

source_sentence: 我於毘鉢尸，　　作斯善業故；　經九十一劫，　　不曾生惡趣。
translation: Because I did this good deed at Vipaśyin, I went through 91 eons without ever being born in a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 常受大天身，　　恒受勝天樂；　多生於人趣，　　大富多財寶。
translation: I'll always be blessed with the body of a great god, and I'll always experience the pleasures of a great god. I'll be reborn in a human rebirth, with great wealth and riches.

source_sentence: 此是最後受，　　今得為人身；　生大淨行族，　　大富具多財。
translation: This is the last experience, and now I've been made a human being born into a great clan of pure practitioners, with great wealth and plenty of possessions.

source_sentence: 披其祕典趣，　　文義及占相；　章句皆通了，　　及大人相好。
translation: He discloses the teachings of his secret scriptures, explains the meaning and characteristics of the texts, comprehends all the phrases, and presents the major figures with good looks.

source_sentence: 於其淨行林，　　教授五百人；　婆羅門眾圍，　　出城歸林藪。
translation: In that pure practice grove, he taught 500 people, surrounded by a multitude of Brāhmaṇas, to leave the city and return to the forest.

source_sentence: 時我見世尊，　　苾芻眾圍遶；　精進甚勇猛，　　來入摩揭陀。
translation: I then saw the Bhagavān, surrounded by a multitude of monks and nuns, vigorously exerting himself, enter Magadha.

source_sentence: 既見大悲士，　　情便生淨信；　由斯因緣故，　　得知其勝相。
translation: Once I saw that greatly compassionate man, my feelings became pure faith, and because of these causes and conditions, I was able to know his surpassing features.

source_sentence: 既出見世父，　　備足諸妙相；　三十二端嚴，　　八十諸好飾。
translation: Once he emerged and saw his worldly father, he was fully endowed with marvelous features, thirty-two finely adorned, and eighty beautifully adorned.

source_sentence: 見此端嚴相，　　虔誠頂禮足；　恭敬合掌立，　　讚歎大導師：『相論所言者，　　唯仁得具備；　必定是大師，　　世間無與等。
translation: Seeing these finely adorned features, they bowed their heads with reverence and bowed their feet, respectfully joined their palms, and praised the great guide, 'Only benevolence possesses what the Xianglun says; it must be the great teacher, and there's no equal in the world.'

source_sentence: 勝梵過帝釋，　　更無有雙者；　超日越地神，　　十方界無比。
translation: He's surpassing Brahmā and surpassing Indra, and there's no equal; surpassing the sun and surpassing the earth's gods, he's without parallel in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 不見過佛者，　　豈能相比類；　天上及人間，　　為大摧魔將。
translation: How could anyone who hasn't seen the Buddha compare with his peers? Up in heaven and among humans, he's a great demon-buster.

source_sentence: 無怙中為依，　　無導中為導；　我願作聲聞，　　我希依奉教。』
translation: Taking refuge in the absence of a father and guiding in the absence of guidance, I vow to become a śrāvaka, and I hope to follow the teaching.'

source_sentence: 赫奕金色臂，　　百福莊嚴相；　世父舒垂下，　　摩我於頂上。
translation: His golden arms are resplendent, his features adorned with a hundred blessings, and his worldly father bends down and touches me on the top of his head.

source_sentence: 蒙告：『汝心淨，　　多獲諸勝利；　能發淨心施，　　其福無邊限。
translation: He told me, 'With a pure heart, you'll reap many excellent benefits; if you can give with a pure heart, your merits will have no limit.

source_sentence: 於無上福田，　　能生淨妙意；　良田下種已，　　摩納婆皆辦。
translation: In the unsurpassed field of merit, you'll be able to produce pure, sublime intentions; after planting seeds in a good field, all the manas will be accomplished.

source_sentence: 永斷無利趣，　　不有惡道怖；　得開甘露門，　　所愛悉成就。
translation: He'll permanently end the path to no profit and have no fear of the bad path; he'll open the gate of ambrosia and obtain all his desires.

source_sentence: 必若樂出家，　　隨意而來作；　急宜棄鬚髮，　　可置婆羅門。』
translation: If he were happy to leave home, he'd come to do as he pleased; it's better to discard his hair and put it in a brāhmaṇa.'

source_sentence: 既聞佛法音，　　遍告諸門徒；　門徒啟告我：　　『為禿沙門耶，　云何捨白淨，　　而取於黑處；　棄其勝妙族，　　欲習卑賤類？
translation: After hearing the Buddha's teaching, he addressed his disciples, who then asked me, 'Suppose you were a bald-headed monk, why would you abandon white purity and take up a dark place, discarding your noble and wonderful family in favor of training a lowly one?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門種類，　　世間最超越；　梵王從胸口，　　化出婆羅門。』
translation: 'The type of brāhmaṇa is the most surpassed in the world, and from his chest, the Brahmā King produces brāhmaṇas.'

source_sentence: 『汝等無開覺，　　汝等無所知；　汝所習學教，　　唯我善能詠。
translation: 'You have no initial awakening, you know nothing, and I'm the only one who can well recite the teaching you've studied.

source_sentence: 如我所明解，　　文義說無窮；　我隨解應作，　　汝等隨緣散。
translation: As I have explained, the text's meaning is inexhaustible; I will interpret it as it should be interpreted, and you will scatter it according to your conditions.

source_sentence: 若無有所須，　　各隨其意樂；　我更不為師，　　亦不復教示。』
translation: If there's nothing you need, follow your heart's desire; I'll no longer be your teacher, nor will I teach you again.'

source_sentence: 時此諸門徒，　　泣淚向前來；　悲涕皆憂惱，　　隨便四散去。
translation: The disciples then came forward weeping and mourning, and they were all sad and distressed as they scattered.

source_sentence: 大悲靜寂士，　　善言慰告我：『可來善苾芻。』
translation: The greatly compassionate Quiet Man spoke kindly to comfort me, saying, 'You may come, good monk.'

source_sentence: 我即具近圓。
translation: I then fully and completely approached them.

source_sentence: 發正清淨心，　　捨俗而出家；　備諸大神通，　　所作已成辦。
translation: I aroused a correct and pure mind, left the secular world and left home, and equipped myself with great supernormal powers that have accomplished what I did.

source_sentence: 我今觀先業，　　天眼悉明淨；　知生及死相，　　所曾受身處。
translation: Now, as I look at my prior actions, the divine eye is fully purified, and I know the phases of birth and death and the places where I once received bodies.

source_sentence: 證神通竟者，　　竭有漏際者；　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: He who has realized the end of his supernormal powers and has exhausted the limits of contamination will explain the results of those prior actions in the pool of no-hot affliction."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告尊者憍陳如言：「具壽因緣已說業報竟，次至尊者說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks addressed Venerable Kauṇḍinya, saying, "After explaining the effects of karma for a long life, we'll go next to the venerable and tell it."

source_sentence: 于時憍陳如即說頌曰：「乃往過去世，　　迦攝佛滅後；　見諸聲聞眾，　　共集作是議：『大悲迦攝波，　　應為後涅槃；　出家者甚少，　　正法不彰明。
translation: Kauṇḍinya then spoke a verse, "In a past life, after Kāśyapa Buddha died, he saw a multitude of śrāvakas gather together and say, 'Greatly compassionate Kāśyapa, this should be the latter nirvāṇa; there are few renunciants, and the right teaching isn't clearly explained.

source_sentence: 我等所聞法，　　互相而教示；　精進不放逸，　　於佛教勤修。
translation: We heard the Dharma, taught it to each other, made effort and didn't neglect it, and diligently cultivated it in Buddhism.

source_sentence: 共登於山上，　　布草以為座；　各要漏不斷，　　不從座而起。』
translation: We ascend together on a mountain, spread out straw for a seat, and each wants the contaminants to stop, so we don't get up from our seat.'

source_sentence: 由懷精進故，　　不惜其身命；　六人證神通，　　便入於涅槃。
translation: Because of their zeal, they don't spare their own lives; six people realize supernormal powers, and then they enter nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 我第七根劣，　　不能斷諸漏；　有法相應心，　　處凡而命過。
translation: My seventh faculty is weak, and I can't stop the contaminants; my mind is associated with the Dharma, and I'm relegated to ordinary life.

source_sentence: 由法相應住，　　不捨精進念；　便得生天上，　　於覩史多宮。
translation: Because I abide in conformity with the teachings and don't abandon diligence, I'll be born up in heaven, in Tushita's palace.

source_sentence: 遂見釋師子，　　牟尼大菩薩；　與諸天說法，　　致令得開覺。
translation: I then saw the lion of the Śākyas, the great Muni bodhisattva, preaching to the gods and causing them to attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我聞彼說法，　　一心而聽受；　深樂其正法，　　無心暫捨離。
translation: I heard his teaching, whole-heartedly listened to it, deeply enjoyed his right teaching, and didn't think of abandoning it for a moment.

source_sentence: 天上業報盡，　　下生劫比羅；　為憍陳如姓，　　淨行豪族中。
translation: The results of my karma up in heaven are ended, and I'm born below in Kapila, among the noble clan of Kauṇḍinya's family and pure practices.

source_sentence: 淨飯大王子，　　備名稱菩薩；　信心捨國出，　　苦行於林藪。
translation: The great prince Jīvaka, known as the Bodhisattva, confidently leaves his country and travels painfully through the forest.

source_sentence: 最君大淨飯，　　勅我如是語：『可去而出家，　　供承其太子。』
translation: The most reverend, Jīvaka Jīvaka, commanded me to say this, 'Go away and leave home to serve his prince.'

source_sentence: 我以清淨心，　　即供承菩薩；　將非證聖道，　　厭捨而方去。
translation: With a pure heart, I then offered myself to the bodhisattva; I would not realize the noble path, but I would abandon it and leave.

source_sentence: 釋迦大牟尼，　　正轉法輪時；　於此諸妙法，　　最初我證悟。
translation: When Śākyamuni was turning the wheel of the Dharma, I first realized these wonderful qualities.

source_sentence: 迦攝波佛教，　　出家修梵行；　今得逢正覺，　　證獲於無漏。
translation: Kāśyapa Buddha, who left home and cultivated the religious practice, now meets right awakening and realizes the untainted.

source_sentence: 憍陳如苾芻，　　對大僧伽眾，　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: Kauṇḍinya Bhikṣu addressed the great congregation of monks at the Lake of No Distress, explaining this prior karmic retribution."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻復告具壽鄔波離曰：「尊者憍陳如已說業報，次至具壽說。」
translation: The senior monks then again addressed Kauśāmbī, saying, "Venerable Kauśāmbī has already explained the results of actions, so let's next go to Kauśāmbī and tell him."

source_sentence: 于時鄔波離即說頌曰：「乃於往昔時，　　波羅痆斯都；　有王名梵授，　　我為常供承。
translation: Upāli then spoke a verse, saying, "Once upon a time, in the capital of Pārāṇasī, there was a king named Brahmā who was always in my service.

source_sentence: 淨飾王髭髮，　　種種使端嚴；　衣服皆相類，　　熏香而奉持。
translation: He adorned the king's moustache and hair with a variety of finery, matched his clothing, and perfumed it with incense and worshiped it.

source_sentence: 懷悲敬重心，　　奉事於大王；　含喜於王處，　　說未曾聞頌：『欲是極少味，　　而為罪根本；　憂苦皆緣此，　　安樂無由得。
translation: With compassion and respect, I served the king and held joy in his heart as he spoke a verse never heard before, 'Desire is a very small taste, but it's the root of sin; it's the cause of grief and suffering, and there's no way to attain well-being.'

source_sentence: 若出家捨欲，　　得聞未曾聞；　臣今情慕極，　　願王聽捨俗。』
translation: If I were to leave home and abandon desire, I'd hear something I've never heard before; now, my feelings are so great that I wish the king would listen to me and abandon conventionality.'

source_sentence: 時王告我曰：　　『卿若能決定；　出家後見我，　　即許卿捨俗。』
translation: The king then told me, 'If you can decide to renounce the world and see me after leaving home, then I will allow you to abandon conventionality.'

source_sentence: 我啟大王言：　　『審知決定意；　願王悉臣心，　　出家後來見。』
translation: I told the king, 'I want you to know what you want to do; may the king understand my mind and come to see me after leaving home.'

source_sentence: 既蒙王聽許，　　便詣於林藪；　懷直不諂心，　　捨俗而出家。
translation: Now that the king has given his approval, he goes to the forest, harbors a straightforward, unblaming heart, and leaves home after renouncing the world.

source_sentence: 隨其力出家，　　得至於離欲；　修習四靜慮，　　勤念不放逸。
translation: Following his power to leave home, he attained freedom from desire, cultivated the four meditations, and was diligent in mindfulness and not careless.

source_sentence: 此王在世時，　　我名殑波羅；　具大尊貴德，　　人眾咸恭敬。
translation: When this king was alive, I was called Swoonhammer, a man of great honor and virtue who was respected by everyone.

source_sentence: 又以正直心，　　詣師所頂禮；　一邊而胡跪，　　合掌如是白：『親教師存念，　　證我有未聞；　須往梵授處，　　現身令正見。』
translation: With a correct and upright mind, I went to the teacher, paid homage, knelt down at one side, put my palms together, and said, 'My dear teacher is mindful that I've never heard anything before and that I need to go to the place of the Brahma teaching to reveal myself and make myself see correctly.'

source_sentence: 師告我：『聽詣，　　波羅痆斯城；　可存決定信，　　勿得招虛妄。
translation: The teacher told me, 'Listen, Persian city, you may keep your faith in certainty, so you won't be led astray.

source_sentence: 我今聽許汝，　　汝當隨我語；　令其王中最，　　興發清淨心。』
translation: Now that I've given you my permission, you must follow my words and cause the greatest of kings to arouse a pure mind.'

source_sentence: 蒙師正直許，　　我即右旋遶；　奉辭隨漸進，　　詣波羅痆斯。
translation: Having received the teacher's rightful approval, I then circled to my right, followed my gradual advancement with respect, and went to Pārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 梵授王聞至，　　親來於我處；　及由王威德，　　諸天亦隨來。
translation: When the king of Brahmā heard that he had arrived, he personally came to me; and because of the king's authority, the gods also came along.

source_sentence: 王從車而下，　　敬心頂禮我；　虔仰極尊重，　　合掌一邊坐。
translation: The king descended from the chariot, paid homage to me with respect, revered me with the utmost respect, and sat with his palms together.

source_sentence: 我即為說法，　　令其斷諸欲；　王聞深欽敬，　　頓捨諸欲事。
translation: I then taught him the Dharma and caused him to stop desires, and the king heard my profound respect and suddenly abandoned all desires.

source_sentence: 便發猛利心，　　復作如是言：『我今求出家，　　不樂諸欲事。』
translation: He then aroused ardent interest and again said, 'Now, I want to leave home and don't enjoy things that are desirable.'

source_sentence: 我告王可來，　　詣於淨林藪；　親近大仙所，　　而為作出家。
translation: I told the king he could come, go to a pure forest, get close to a great sage, and make himself at home.

source_sentence: 王便冊長子，　　紹繼其國位；　此大最勝王，　　捨國歸出家。
translation: The king then gathered his eldest son to inherit his kingdom, and this great, most excellent king left his kingdom and left home.

source_sentence: 王與妃宮婇，　　臣佐及宗親；　大眾皆圍遶，　　詣求出家處。
translation: The king, his mistress, his palace, his ministers, and his clan relatives were all gathered around him, and they all went to seek refuge in the house.

source_sentence: 王以正直心，　　頂禮諸仙足；　合掌求請遍，　　願與為出家。
translation: With a correct and upright mind, the king bowed his head at the feet of the sages, put his palms together, and asked them all to join him as a renunciant.

source_sentence: 與王剃鬚髮，　　身披袈裟服；　無量百千眾，　　皆捨俗出家。
translation: The king shaved his hair and put on the reddish-brown robes, and measureless hundreds of thousands of people renounced the secular world and left home.

source_sentence: 我求正直心，　　演說清妙法；　令使諸聞者，　　得生四靜慮。
translation: Seeking to be upright in mind, I expounded the pure and wonderful Dharma so that those who heard it might give rise to the four meditations.

source_sentence: 我以懷慈念，　　恭敬大王故；　命盡臨終時，　　生無邊光天。
translation: With kindness in my heart, I honored the great king, and when my life ended, I was born in the heaven of infinite light.

source_sentence: 於彼天捨報，　　生來於此處；　凡所生生處，　　大富多財寶。
translation: Where I'm born, I'll be greatly prosperous and wealthy.

source_sentence: 天上及人間，　　常受勝妙樂；　此為最後時，　　斯是最後身。
translation: Up in heaven and among humans, they'll always experience marvelous happiness; this is the final time, and this is the final body.

source_sentence: 生劫比羅城，　　釋迦豪族中；　常知所進趣，　　恒為侍釋迦。
translation: Born in the city of Kapphiṇa among the noble family of the Śākyas, he always knows what he's pursuing and serves the Śākyas constantly.

source_sentence: 聲聞釋迦子，　　我為作承事；　由大王威德，　　而得為出家。
translation: I've been a mentor to the śrāvaka son of the śrāvaka, and it was because of the great king's authority that I became a renunciant.

source_sentence: 我與剃鬚髮，　　作如是白言：『聖者不相濟，　　我當云何活？』
translation: Shaving our hair and beards, we said, 'How will I live if the noble ones don't help each other?'

source_sentence: 所有嚴瓔珞，　　及諸上妙服；　告言：『今與汝，　　用充為活命。』
translation: "He had all these ornaments and jewelry and these wonderful robes, and he told them, 'Now, I'll give them to you to help you save my life.'

source_sentence: 我見多珍寶，　　心生大追悔：『宜皆盡捨置，　　樂求為出家。
translation: When I saw how many treasures there were, I felt great remorse, 'It's better to put them all away and seek to leave home.

source_sentence: 我今貧困苦，　　持此多珍寶；　若有知聞者，　　必來而害我。
translation: Now, I'm poor and suffering, and I'm holding so many treasures; if someone knew and heard about them, they would come and harm me.

source_sentence: 可留已調度，　　及此諸珍寶。』
translation: Perhaps I could leave these treasures and the rest of my family after they've been trained.'

source_sentence: 即掛於樹上，　　亦求為出家。
translation: He then hung them on a tree and also sought to become a renunciant.

source_sentence: 釋迦諸王子，　　聞我如是說；　令我先出家，　　悉皆禮我足。
translation: The Śākyamuni princes heard me say this, told me to leave home first, and all bowed their heads to my feet.

source_sentence: 佛哀愍我故，　　告善來苾芻；　我既出家後，　　然度諸王族。
translation: Because the Buddha had pity for me, he told the well-coming monks, 'After I leave home, I'll then save the princes.'

source_sentence: 彼眾禮我足，　　頓摧於我慢；　既調為出家，　　證得六神通。
translation: They all bowed their heads to my feet, which suddenly destroyed their pride in themselves. Having been trained to leave home, they then realized the six supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 六通阿羅漢，　　超際於彼岸；　蒙佛記於我，　　持律為第一。
translation: An arhat of the six powers transcends the other shore, and it's written in my memory by the Buddha that I'm number one in observing the precepts.

source_sentence: 鄔波離苾芻，　　對諸僧伽眾，　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: Speaking to the Saṃgha, Bhagavān Upāli told them about the effects of prior karma at the Lake of No Distress."

source_sentence: 于時大導師，　　告尊者為光：「可說先業報，　　曾受諸善惡。」
translation: The great guide then told Venerable Vairocana to be radiant, "You can tell about the effects of prior actions that were previously experienced as good and bad."

source_sentence: 彼聞佛音告，　　即憶先業事；　白言對佛前：　　「今說諸果報。
translation: When he heard the Buddha's voice, he recalled the deeds of his prior actions and said to the Buddha, "Now I'll explain the results of those prior actions.

source_sentence: 昔在蓮花上，　　救世最勝尊；　有塔在曠林，　　多饒諸惡獸。
translation: Once, he was on a lotus flower, the most honored one who saved the world; there was a stūpa in a forest, and he spared many unwholesome animals.

source_sentence: 無人能往彼，　　恭敬申供養；　在彼側近人，　　不知罪福報。
translation: No one can go there, respectfully make offerings, or approach someone who doesn't know the rewards of sin and merit.

source_sentence: 我即詣塔所，　　淨除諸草木；　持[打-丁+彗]遍灑掃，　　悉使周嚴飾。
translation: I then went to the stūpa, cleansed the grass and trees, and swept it all over with a [tha-din+comet], making it completely adorned.

source_sentence: 虔恭禮八方，　　敬重已便迴；　由斯善根故，　　得生於天上。
translation: I reverently paid homage to the eight directions, and after paying respect, I turned back; because of these good roots, I was born up in heaven.

source_sentence: 於三十三天，　　受諸勝欲樂；　經三十六返，　　而得為天王。
translation: In the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, I experienced great desires and pleasures, and after thirty-six rebirths, I became king of the gods.

source_sentence: 我所住天宮，　　常為金赫耀；　廣有三十六，　　長六十繕那。
translation: The palace in which I live is always shining brightly with gold; it's 36 wide and 60 long.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　下生於人趣，　　七返為人主。
translation: Again, there's something rare about me that makes me adorn and purify a stūpa; I'm born down in a human rebirth and become the lord of humans seven times over.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　曾所受生處，　　身有金光耀。
translation: "Again, I've had the wonder of a gloriously clean stūpa, and where I was once born, my body shines with gold.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　恒生婆羅門，　　剎帝利豪族。
translation: "Again, I've had the wonder, because of the glorious and pure Buddha-stūpa, to be born constantly to a Brahmin or a powerful family of Kārttiyas.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　隨意乘車輿，　　象馬不步行。
translation: "Again, I've had the wonder, because of the gloriously pure Buddha-stūpa, to ride in a chariot or horse at will, not to walk on elephants or horses.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　若踐荊棘林，　　自然皆屏息。
translation: "Again, there's something rare about me, because I've kept the stūpa Vairocana pure; if I walk through a thorn forest, I'll naturally hold my breath.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　不曾遭疾患，　　亦無諸撗惱。
translation: "Again, I'm so wonderful, because I've kept the stūpa strictly pure, that I never suffer illness or trouble.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　凡所遊行處，　　吉祥相皆現。
translation: "Again, I'm surprised, because I have a gloriously clean stūpa, that everywhere I travel, auspicious appearances appear.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　常得尊勝貴，　　敬事如大天。
translation: "Again, I'm surprised, because I have a gloriously clean stūpa, that I'm always honored and privileged, and I serve like a great god.

source_sentence: 我復有希奇，　　嚴淨佛塔故；　不曾身有苦，　　及餘諸少惱。
translation: "Again, there's something rare about me, because I've kept the stūpa of the Buddha perfectly clean; I've never had physical pain or any other minor affliction.

source_sentence: 佛法無瑕穢，　　如是不思議；　淨心獲大果，　　亦復不思議。
translation: The Buddha's teaching is unsullied, so it's inconceivable, and the attainment of the great fruit of a pure mind is also inconceivable.

source_sentence: 若求勝妙樂，　　盡除生死者；　應敬如來塔，　　奉事無上尊。
translation: Those who seek the surpassing and marvelous pleasure of ridding themselves of birth and death should venerate the Tathāgata's stūpa and serve the unsurpassed honored one.

source_sentence: 大德是我念，　　先世為善業；　得受其果報，　　甚深有愛樂。
translation: "Great is my mindfulness that I did good actions in prior lives that brought about their results, which were profoundly pleasing.

source_sentence: 此為光苾芻，　　對大僧伽眾；　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This is the Bhāviveka Bhikṣu addressing the great congregation of monks and speaking of the results of prior actions in the lake of no distress."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻告具壽奎宿曰：「具壽為光已說業報訖，次至具壽說。」
translation: It was then that the senior monks addressed Kauśāmbī, saying, "Kauśāmbī has finished explaining the results of actions for Guangming, and Kauśāmbī will explain them next."

source_sentence: 于時奎宿即說頌曰：「大德我思念，　　過去俱胝劫；　於一切超佛，　　而為善品業。
translation: It was then that Kuiśāmbī spoke a verse, "I've been thinking, O great virtuous one, about all the transcendent buddhas of the past kalpas, and I've created good qualities of actions.

source_sentence: 時佛無上尊，　　無邊百千億；　聲聞眾圍遶，　　欲入大王都。
translation: At the time, the Buddha was a peerless being of measureless hundreds of billions, and he was surrounded by a multitude of śrāvakas who wanted to enter the great king's capital.

source_sentence: 我從餘村落，　　緣事至其處；　遂見等正覺，　　具三十二相。
translation: I went from another village to that place by circumstance, and then I saw the perfectly enlightened one with thirty-two marks.

source_sentence: 如月與日照，　　如火電冥光；　映蔽諸光輝，　　佛光最超耀。
translation: Like the moon and sun shining, like fire and lightning in the dark, they shine brightly, but the Buddha's light shines brightest.

source_sentence: 我常未覩此，　　如然大火聚；　又見彼佛前，　　有一婆羅門。
translation: I've never seen this before, but it's like a great ball of fire; I also saw a Brāhmaṇa in front of that Buddha.

source_sentence: 我即諮問彼，　　報言佛導師；　人天無倫匹，　　無與等正覺。
translation: I then asked him about it and was told, "Instructor Buddha, there's no equal among humans and gods, and there's no equal to the perfectly enlightened one.

source_sentence: 既聞佛音告，　　心生淨欣樂；　深愛其顏儀，　　遍體得安樂。
translation: Having heard the Buddha's voice, my heart became pure with joy and happiness, and I deeply desired his countenance, attaining well-being throughout my body.

source_sentence: 復聞天樂音，　　非人讚頌聲；　天雨末香花，　　雨此上勝城。
translation: Then I heard the heavenly music, not the sound of human praise; the gods rained down flowers of fragrance at the end of the day, raining down on this outstanding city.

source_sentence: 有散青蓮花，　　有雨贍博迦；　或以旃檀末，　　或有但合掌。
translation: Some scatter blue lotus flowers, some rain jambhāka, some use sandalwood, and some simply fold their palms.

source_sentence: 諸天在空中，　　虔恭上旋繞；　情生深愛仰，　　遍禮喜盈溢。
translation: The gods in the sky respectfully ascend and circumambulate them, giving rise to deep feelings of admiration and overflowing with joy as they worship them.

source_sentence: 為求香鬘故，　　四散而馳覓；　我於此時中，　　遍遊無一花。
translation: Seeking fragrant garlands, they scatter in search of them; at this point in time, I've traveled far and wide without a single flower.

source_sentence: 去我而不遠，　　遂見賣蓋者；　手持白妙傘，　　鮮明如淨貝。
translation: Not far from me, I then saw a man selling canopies, holding a white canopy as bright as a pure shell.

source_sentence: 速詣手捧持，　　諮請暫獻佛；　見許將佛所，　　誠心持蓋立。
translation: He quickly went to the man holding it in his hand, asked him to offer it to the Buddha for a short time, and when he saw him, he accepted the Buddha's place and sincerely held the lid in place.

source_sentence: 蓋從手而去，　　自往佛頂上；　大師行即動，　　大師住即住；　不捨調寂身，　　自然於空中。
translation: The lid goes out of his hand and goes up to the Buddha's head; the teacher moves as he moves, the teacher stands as he stands; he doesn't abandon his quiescent body and naturally takes to the air.

source_sentence: 我與諸大眾，　　覩斯大神變，　虔恭皆合掌，　　誠心咸頂禮。
translation: Seeing this great miracle, we and the rest of the crowd reverently clasped our hands and sincerely bowed our heads in homage.

source_sentence: 見等正覺相，　　聲聞眾儀式；　至家為事業，　　繫心常思念：　快哉獲善果，　　見佛有所懷。
translation: We see the marks of virtual enlightenment, the rituals of the śrāvakas, go home and work, and fix our minds in constant thought, "Wouldn't it be nice to attain the good fruit of seeing the Buddha in our hearts?

source_sentence: 我由奉佛蓋，　　無上福田處；　由此善根故，　　七寶常嚴備。
translation: Because I serve the Buddha's lid, I'm in a place of unsurpassed fortune; because of these good roots, the seven treasures are always fully furnished.

source_sentence: 後於臨終時，　　生三十三天；　得為天中王，　　諸天皆敬重。
translation: At the time of my final rebirth, I'll be born in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and become king of the gods, revered by the gods.

source_sentence: 復生於人趣，　　名為自力王；　大富多勤勇，　　餘王咸奉事。
translation: Again, he'll be born in a human destiny and be called the king of self-power; he'll be abundantly wealthy and courageous, and all the other kings will serve him.

source_sentence: 由斯作善品，　　流轉所生處；　善根不斷絕，　　復續諸妙因。
translation: Because of this creation of good qualities, he'll be reborn in a place of transmigration, where his good roots won't end and he'll continue to have marvelous causes.

source_sentence: 於彼勝福田，　　淨心而奉蓋；　因此善業故，　　不墮於惡趣。
translation: In that field of excellent merit, he purely consecrates his mind; as a result of this good action, he doesn't fall into a bad destiny.

source_sentence: 此為最後身，　　生在於人趣；　虔恭調御士，　　無上等正覺。
translation: This is the final body, born in a human destiny, a reverent and disciplined man, and unsurpassed and perfectly enlightened.

source_sentence: 釋迦師子教，　　而得為出家；　證獲阿羅漢，　　寂滅清涼處。
translation: After being taught by the Śākyamuni lion, he becomes a renunciant and realizes the state of an arhat, where tranquility and coolness prevail.

source_sentence: 魔變身如山，　　高一踰膳那；　作大恐怖形，　　如空中黑雲。
translation: The demon transforms his body into a mountain that's more than a yojana high and takes on a large, terrifying shape like a black cloud in the sky.

source_sentence: 告言：『是何物，　　敢為而惱亂？』
translation: He told them, 'What is it that dares to cause disruption?'

source_sentence: 察知是其魔，　　故來相逼惱。
translation: He perceives that it's Māra, and he comes to oppress him.

source_sentence: 報言：『魔波旬，　　隨意而現身；　頭可如須彌，　　方來於我處。』
translation: He replied, 'Māra Pāpīyān, who shows up in body as he wishes, has a head like Sumeru and then comes to me.'

source_sentence: 已證阿羅漢，　　具三明聲聞；　佛所示誨法，　　得為安樂住。
translation: Having realized arhatship and become a śrāvaka with the three kinds of insight, he attains a comfortable abode based on the Buddha's instruction of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 受他一揣食，　　在定於七日；　悟解脫意樂，　　是我所修習。
translation: Accepting a portion of food from another, he remains in meditation for seven days; this is my intention for enlightenment and liberation that I've cultivated.

source_sentence: 大德我思念，　　先世作善業；　多受其果報，　　可樂甚精妙。
translation: I consider, O great virtuous one, the good actions of past lives, the many rewards of which I've received, and the subtleties of what's enjoyable.

source_sentence: 此奎宿苾芻，　　對大僧伽眾，　於無熱惱池，　　說斯先業報。」
translation: This Kukkuṭika monk told this great assembly of monks about the results of prior actions in a lake without heat or trouble."

source_sentence: 爾時諸耆宿苾芻各各自說先世業已，白世尊言：「我等已說先世業報，唯願世尊開演先業。
translation: After each of those senior monks and nuns had explained the results of their prior actions, they said to the Bhagavān, "We've already explained the results of our prior actions, so let's hope the Bhagavān will reveal our prior actions.

source_sentence: 大德世尊！
translation: Venerable Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 先作何業？
translation: What kind of karma do we do first?

source_sentence: 成正覺後，山石摧下轥傷足指。」
translation: After he attains perfect enlightenment, a mountain rock falls and burns his toes."

translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Such a person was born in a different category in the past and created this action himself, which he must accept on his own.

source_sentence: 增長熟時，緣變現前，如影隨形，必定感報，無餘代受。
translation: When it grew and matured, conditioned transformations manifested themselves like shadows following their forms, and they were sure to bring about their own retribution, with nothing left to accept on their behalf.

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若人所作善惡之業，不於外界地水火風，令其受報，皆於自身蘊界處中而招異熟。」
translation: If a person does good and bad actions that don't bring about rewards in the external world of earth, water, fire, and wind, they all bring about retribution in their own aggregates, realms, and fields."

source_sentence: 即說頌曰：「假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡；　因緣會遇時，　　果報還自受。」
translation: He then spoke a verse, "Suppose it takes a hundred eons, but the actions that are performed don't perish; when causes and conditions meet, the results are again felt on their own."

source_sentence: 又告諸苾芻：「乃往古昔，於聚落中有一長者，娶妻未久遂誕一男，年漸長大，母便命過。
translation: Again, he told the monks, "Once upon a time, there was an elder in a village who married a man who hadn't been married long before he had a son, and when he grew older, his mother's life passed away.

source_sentence: 其父長者娶後母來，不久有娠，復生一子。
translation: His father, an elderly man, married his stepmother, and soon after she became pregnant, another son was born.

source_sentence: 後與長兒，納娶妻房，多生兒女。
translation: Later, he and his eldest son took a wife and wedded a wife, and many children were born to them.

source_sentence: 後於異時，後母身死，弟投兄處，嫂問夫言曰：『此是誰兒？』
translation: When his stepmother died at a different time, his younger brother went to his brother's place, and his sister-in-law asked her husband, 'Whose son is this?'

translation: He replied, 'Yes, Brother!'

translation: Should I share my family's wealth with my brother?'

translation: If he is one person, how can we, the many, stop the division?'

translation: His wife also repeatedly said, 'There's nothing bad that a person with a mind defiled by desire can't do.'

source_sentence: 夫詣一邊，作如是念：『若於村落而殺害之，人眾咸知；可將闌若無人之處。』
translation: The man went aside and thought, 'If we were to kill or injure them in the village, everyone would know about it; we could go to the deserted place of Vaiśravaṇa.'

source_sentence: 即命弟曰：『汝持器皿，可共往於闌若採花。』
translation: He then ordered his disciple, 'Take a container, and we can go together to gather flowers in that village.'

translation: He said, 'As you were told.'

translation: They then went together to a hill, pushed Dee into a pot, and struck him with a stone to kill him.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻，於意云何？
translation: You monks, what do you think?

source_sentence: 乃往昔時長者太子而殺弟者，豈異人乎？
translation: Wasn't there someone else in the past who killed his younger brother while he was still a prince?

source_sentence: 我今即是。
translation: "Now, this is me.

source_sentence: 由於往昔為財利故，將別母弟，於闌若處推墮山坎，以石打殺。
translation: In the past, for financial gain, I pushed my other mother's brother over a hill and into a mountain range at a place like this, striking him with a rock and killing him.

source_sentence: 由斯業報，於多年歲，於多百歲，於多千歲、多百千歲，墮於地獄，受諸楚苦。
translation: As a result of that kind of karmic retribution, for many years, a hundred years, a thousand years, or a hundred thousand years, they fell into hell and experienced pain and suffering.

translation: As a result of this residual karmic power, after I became perfectly enlightened, a mountain rock fell and injured my toes."

source_sentence: 成正覺後，紫橿木槍，刺佛足傷。」
translation: After he became perfectly enlightened, he was wounded by a purple quill that pierced the Buddha's foot."

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「如來往昔自作斯業，今還自受。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Tathāgatas created this action themselves in the past, and now they'll take it back."

source_sentence: 廣說乃至頌曰：「假令經百劫，　　所作業不亡；　因緣會遇時，　　果報還自受。」
translation: He spoke at length and even spoke in verse, "Suppose it takes a hundred eons, but that work doesn't perish; when causes and conditions meet, the result is again felt by oneself."

source_sentence: 復告諸苾芻：「乃往古昔，有一大城，於此城中有二商主，善能興易。
translation: Again, he told the monks, "Once upon a time, there was a large city, and in that city there were two merchant owners who were skilled at making barter.

source_sentence: 縛持舶已，為求寶故入於海際，因順風力至其寶洲。
translation: After they had tied up their ships and entered the sea in search of treasure, they followed the force of the wind to their island of treasure.

source_sentence: 一籌量載寶，一不籌量貪心滿舶。
translation: One planned to carry the treasure, but the other didn't plan to fill the ship with greed.

source_sentence: 後入海內，不籌量者其舶欲沒，告伴商主言：『願仁救濟，容我上舶。』
translation: When they later entered the sea, the one who didn't measure up had his ship about to sink, and he told his companion, the merchant, 'May you be kind and save me, and allow me to board the ship.'

source_sentence: 其人斟酌，隨力量寶安於舶內，牽取其手令使在舶。
translation: That man considered the situation, then placed a treasure of strength inside the ship, took it by the hand, and made it sit on the ship.

source_sentence: 其溺舶者作如是念：『我與共彼同至寶洲，我所採者舶沒皆失，豈容其人將寶歸家？
translation: The man who was submerged in the ship thought, 'We both went to that precious island together, and all the things I gathered were lost when the ship sank, so how could I allow that man to return the treasure home?'

source_sentence: 穿舶為孔，令寶散失。』
translation: Piercing the boat as a hole caused the treasure to be lost.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，竊在一邊持杖穿舶。
translation: After he thought this, he stole a staff and pierced the ship with it.

translation: The merchant then saw him and told him, 'Sir!

translation: Don't do this; not only will your treasure be scattered, but we'll all perish.'

translation: Their inner jealousy was so intense that they didn't even accept the advice and wanted to wear the same clothes as before.

source_sentence: 其伴商主，見不從諫，即持利槍刺之令死。
translation: When his companion, the merchant, didn't heed his advice, he took a sharp spear and stabbed him to death.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻，於意云何？
translation: 'You monks, what do you think?'

translation: Was it someone else who stabbed and killed others in the past?
